title: 106_hr2331
content: Increased exclusion and modifications for qualified small business stock. Increased exclusion for gain from certain small business stock under section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to 100 percent. Conforming amendments are made to related sections of the Code. The exclusion for gain from certain small business stock under section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is increased to 100 percent. The holding period is reduced from 5 years to 3 years. This exclusion is available to corporations. The exclusion for gain from certain small business stock under section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is increased to 100 percent for corporations. Stock held among members of a controlled group is not eligible for this exclusion. Additionally, the minimum tax preference under section 57 of the Code is repealed. Section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to increase the exclusion for gain from small business stock to 100 percent for corporations. The definition of qualified small business is revised to raise the asset limitation from $50,000,000 to $300,000,000, with an inflation adjustment provision for stock issued after 2000. The amendment to Section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code includes the repeal of the per-issuer limitation and other modifications such as the repeal of the working capital limitation and exceptions from redemption rules for businesses. The amendment to Section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code includes exceptions from redemption rules for businesses, allowing a purchase of stock by the issuing corporation to be disregarded if there was a business purpose and not to avoid limitations. The amendments made by this section apply to stock issued after the date of enactment of this Act, with special rules for stock issued after August 10, 1993. SEC. 2. REPEAL OF MINIMUM TAX PREFERENCE FOR EXCLUSION FOR INCENTIVE STOCK OPTIONS. Amends section 56 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by removing paragraph (3). Effective for options exercised in calendar years after the enactment of this Act.
